title: i have an idea to replace permbans
body:
Theres this other game I play with what's called a "hacker pool" which is just separate matchmaking for known hackers. The players aren't banned, they just get matched with other hackers.

So league could have a "toxic pool", for all the toxic people. This would allow toxic people to keep playing but not bother any one else, and it would also be a little more generous considering that many people (mostly banned people) are opposed to long term bans especially when it comes to an account the money was spent on.
It would also clean out the massive amount of threads on this board that are just "Should this have been banned [insert easily bannable toxicity]" or "I spent $x and now I'm banned aaahhhh".

I think it's a great idea but let me know what you guys think!

edit
well it looks like the votes speak for themselves. Wow you guys really hate toxic players huh? Can't even give them a place amongst themselves to play? Honestly it seems that you're more interested in punishing people than actually cleaning up the community. And to be honest I find that toxic in and of itself.

I just think it's important to keep in mind that Riot is only generous because it benefits them. If they could make more money by _not_ being generous, the generosity would stop.

This idea has quite a few problems:

1. The number of toxic players is significantly smaller than the total player base, leading to poor matchmaking in a toxic pool.
2. Toxicity breeds toxicity, so the solution makes it harder for players who are not yet at the point where they would be permanently banned to reform.
3. Not all toxic players are the same kind of toxic, so the environment would be pretty awful, and some players who were only slightly toxic to many times would be forced to play with those who spew hate speech in every game.
4. It cost money to support a separate server, and money to develop a system like this. From a business perspective and the community perspective it's simply not worth investing that money in a small portion of the player base who has proven unwilling to accept the fairly reasonable rules. That money and time could be spent doing things to improve the experience of the players who are good community members.
Riot's already talked about that here: https://nexus.leagueoflegends.com/en-us/2017/01/ask-riot-banished-to-prisoners-island/
